reviewText:
This is what I have to say, and if you're a Ghost Hunters watcher -- you will understand: If you find Brian Harnois the most likeable, entertaining person, there is something seriously wrong with the show.

In my house, we LOVE watching the original Ghost Hunters with Jay and Grant. The investigators are entertaining, while also taking it seriously and having a scientific approach. Jay and Grant are awesome, Steve and Tango are hysterical together. And more importantly, they never easily mark anywhere as 'haunted'.

  I was really stoked when I heard about ghost hunters international(GHI). Being a traveler, I was excited to see if they'd visit any places I'd been, plus nearly everywhere else in the world has a longer history then here in the united states, so a much better chance of actually being haunted. So really, how could they go wrong? Well -- they did, and it was in their choice of investigators. I've heard this from a good number of people and seen it all over online, it's not just me who doesn't like them.

 They are HORRIBLE. Monotone, boring, and they jump on anything, like wind blowing, going "did you hear that?!!!!!" yea, it was the wind dude. The lead guy, Robb, is terrible, listening to him talk, he could put you to sleep. but not entirely, because you're too busy watching his non-stop eyebrows.

 In the current season(2) all anyone can do is stare at the girl, Brandy, with the terrible makeup(I'm not kidding, only wish I were). She's either trying to look like she has sunken eyes or like she has a black eye. They never find anything good and they are always declaring places haunted with the smallest noise or weird happening. With the real ghost hunters, Jay and Grant, they will try to debunk something first..these guys very rarely do that.

So while they do go to super amazing places, those settings are ruined by the terrible cast. Now in season 2, I have finally broken up with GHI because I spent more time yelling at the tv or falling asleep then actually watching the show.

Check out the original Ghost Hunters, you will not be disappointed.
I have been a fan of the show since day one and am trying to collect the whole series. for those who believe in the paranormal there is no better team to follow!

This one of my all time fave shows and it will always be.  I can't say I wouldn't panic and pass out if I'd see half the stuff these guys have and been touched and all but these guys are just awesome to watch in how they actually try to disprove instead of prove and I think that's just awesome..  you will not be disappointed if you decide to order this it won't let you down in interest or excitement.

I got this movie for me I an a huge ghost hunter fan so is my daughter and father who is in a nursing home.  I thought this will be a way we can spend time together..  The movie is like brand new.  This seller had a great price and they delivered them before they said they would.  I will order from this seller again and I have ordered from them several times over the last 2 years.
I loved the show but never realized how boring the first season was. I recommend everyone skip the first season.

If everyone started with the first Season of Ghost Hunters, they might not continue with the show for long.  From the drama, the unprofessional-ism and the revolving cast of characters, it is just hard to sink into.  Luckily, my introduction to this show came later on, when it was in its third season and things had improved so much that I instantly became obsessed with the show.

Ghost Hunters follows TAPS, The Atlantic Paranormal Society, a ghost hunting group set up by Jason Hawes and Grant Wilson, Roto-Rooters by day, family men all the time, and Ghost Hunters in their spare time.  With other investigators, and specialized equipment, they set out to do their best to disprove hauntings.  Which is very different from what most organizations out there do.  They want to have irrevocable proof before they say something paranormal is going on, and that's probably the reason that they've been able to keep the show going as long as it has.  Some of the equipment they use are cameras, heat sensors, and other electronic devices used to show anomalies in their surroundings.

Jason and Grant are the main people in TAPS.  They run it and they make the decisions.  And they are opposites of each other.  Which actually works.  They have a good work chemistry and present their findings to people with ease and respect.  It's nice to see them investigate.  The same doesn't apply to all their investigators though.  There always seems to be drama going on and some of them are quite frankly, annoying and hard to believe.  They seem to work with a lot of people who don't live up to the belief of the organization and see a haunting in every shadow.  Luckily, this is one of the things that improves in future seasons.  I do have to admit that Steve is probably my favorite.  I've always had a little crush on him and he has such a calm personality that it's easy to watch him investigate.  The same can't be said of Brian Harnois, who is excitable, but at least genuine in his excitement.

They brought in demonologists and wiccans and priests in this season and I'm actually rather glad they discontinue that in later seasons.  Bringing it in actually makes it seem not as real and when it is left out, it seems more scientific and believable.  For those that believe in Ghosts anyway.  I felt that these people did not add anything to this season.

For the actual film, it's decent.  But because this is the first season their equipment is not as good as it is in later seasons.  Photos and video are fuzzy and the evidence harder to really see.  Luckily the audio is ok and some of what they catch is quite amazing.  And even some of the video is spectacular, just not as clear as you could hope it would be.  They also have a tendency to use dramatic music that, while it builds suspense, is distracting during the actual investigation parts of the episodes.

TAPS investigates quite a few places in this short season, including private residences, the Mishler Theatre, the Altoona Railroad Museum, the Lighthouse Inn and John Stone Tavern, Race Rock Lighthouse, Eastern State Penitentiary, New Bedford Armory, Topton Tavern, and the New Boston Inn.  Not all of these places have been found to be haunted.  In fact, very few were.  Since this was the first season, all of these places fit onto three disks with ten episodes total.

I really enjoy the show, even if I'm not a fan of the first season.  It's always interesting, they mostly have a good crew, and unusual things happen.  You don't have to believe in ghosts to enjoy it, but it will certainly make you expand your horizons a bit.

Review by M. Reynard 2013
We always look forward to Wednesdays to watch Ghost Hunters, however, this summer there haven't been any re-runs so this has made up for in the interum. Plus we hadn't seen all of the first season.
My friend loves all this stuff. She can't get enough of ghosts and paranormal stuff. She has gotten all the ghost adventures so far.

The first two seasons are my favorites of GH. The DVDs played well, no problems or freezing. Delivered quickly. Something about this show was better when there were money issues, working out of a trailer, and the "Dude, Run" guy with his soap opera. Latecomers to the show need to see the first few seasons to get to know the guys. I've been watching since day one, and miss the original people. One or two of the current bunch get on my nerves, and TAPS almost seems to be a conglomerate, if they are responsible for Ghost Mine and others, I cannot watch them. The humble days were better.
Love love love it.  Again, txt box requires you type to much on the feedback.  I should not be required to leave so many words.  STUPID
So excited I got The Complete First Season to add to my collection! It was in great condition and plays great!

It's about time this show was available on DVD.  I love GHI.  Great locations, the premier of the full spectrum camera.  They've caught so many cool pics with that camera it makes me wonder why Jason and Grant don't use one.  The only way it could be better is if they had put captions or subtitles on the discs.  Can't wait for more GHI!

What Did Jesus Really Say-How Christianity Went Astray: [What To Say To A Born Again Christian Fundamentalist, But Never Had The Information] -- by Peter Cayce [2005] I've been watching Ghost Hunters (via satellite and in the States) from almost the very beginning. I've now seen the original programs and have read the books of Jason and Grant too. I have to say that I believe that ghosts may exist, but I want some kind of evidence. Some kind of proof. These investigators -- and their paranormal investigation team -- work on the same premise. They attempt to "debunk" paranormal claims, but when they gather evidence that is hard to "debunk" or "dispute," they are left with evidence that may actually support life after death (i.e., ghost, paranormal activity). While Ghost Hunters works with a scientific leaning by utilizing technical equipment from EMF meters / K2 meters, digital thermometers, night vision cameras and thermal sensor equipment, etc., other paranormal programs utilize spirit mediums and the like. While I do not discount psychic mediums and sensitives, their evidence is hard to prove or "debunk." Nevertheless, programs like "Paranormal State" and "Paranormal Cops" (broadcast on A&E) have their place as well. They are certainly interesting. Psychic mediums like John Edward and Chip Coffee are quite interesting. In fact, I've been watching John Edward for many years. He's gotten a bit "mushy" as of late (even for WE) -- his original program on SyFy used to display his medium abilities more readily. In short, more readings. Writers and psychic researchers like Peter Cayce are also quite interesting. Peter Cayce utilizes Science, Philosophy and Religion to come up with explanations for the afterlife and reincarnation and Karma. Interesting material. In any case, the paranormal field is an interesting one. I'd really like to see more programs about legitimate psychics and paranormal investigators like Ghost Hunters, John Edward and Peter Cayce. After Life: Answers from the Other Side -- by John Edward [2010]

A great series! I really enjoyed the new team and with guest appearances from TAPS members from back in the states. There are some great locations filmed in GHI that have lots of history to them and are very interesting to see. I highly recommend it for those who love Ghost Hunters. Can't wait for season 2!

Sence I started watching the show I cant seem to get enought of it. I was never the kind of person that can sit down and keep my mind on what im watching or the type to watch anything that had to do with ghost. This is the only show that I watch that has it. I aslo like how the team gets to the point,stay on one thing for a while and doesnt drag things out like "Ghost Lab". Boring. Thanks guys keep up the good work. Loke forward to the next seasons of all the Ghost Hunters.

I gotta say, I'm glad they created GHI.  It took every investigator that I hated from the original series and sent them to the other side of the world.  Thank God! I hate that these idiots have their own show, but at least they aren't ruining the great one anymore.

I love Ghosthunters International. I think it's just as good as the original, with the same concept but more exotic locations. It's interesting to step outside our country to see paranormal activity in other parts of the world. I've been watching Ghosthunters since day one almost 5 years ago, and Ghosthunters International is a great spin-off to the original show! I just wish Donna would return!

During the show's early episodes, Brian, Andy and Donna from the original series had joined the cast.  All three lent lively personalities and years of expertise to the show, and the episodes were great entertainment (although Donna's tendency to shriek gets tedious really fast). But mid-season, these three had left.  The show needed to rely on the lead, Robb, and the "experienced" Barry.  Robb is not a debunker but instead tends to view everything as being haunted.  For instance, he can have an EVP that sounds like someone scraping their shoe on floorboards and he claims the place is haunted. He relies heavily on Barry, and Barry continually comes off as a phoney -- in every episode, something unobservable and unverifiable happens to him, like he claims to be touched or to see something behind a locked door.  Barry runs towards what ends up being nothing, and he runs away from a lot of things too (Brian used to get teased for this!).  Donna's replacement, Brandy, has a nasally voice that is not clear or inviting on TV.  The quality of the investigations is disappointing, and I can't help feeling like GHI is a disservice to the original.  The only reason I am purchasing the DVD (when it finally is released???) is for the earlier episodes that were fun.

I love GHI partly because you learn some history about sites in other countries plus the cast has great camaraderie and professionalism. They don't do all that talking which drowns out possible sounds like the GH crew. There isn't all that drama that Jay and Grant create on GH. All members of GHI are treated with respect and have great enthusiasm which helps the viewer focus on the site instead of the drama between cast members.

They don't claim that every site is haunted, they just say that they can't say one way or another based on the one night at times. It sounds like most viewers want the drama involved in GH. I say no thank you. Give me the positive attitude and Barry's sexy accent anytime. Can't wait until the DVD is released!

Ghosthunters International is a complete waste of time.  The investigators rarely find anything compelling, yet insist that every place is haunted.  "We had some amazing personal experiences" they say.  Well, yeah, I'm afraid that doesn't translate to us as an audience.

The fact of the matter is that GHI is not Ghosthunters.  Robb and his cohorts lack all the charm, wit, and skepticism of Jay, Grant, and the crew of Ghosthunters.  Barry is the absolute worst - he is quick to identify every wind or noise as paranormal activity, then he almost injures his fellow investigators as he runs over them to get away from some proclaimed demonic activity.  And if Barry refers to his "full spectrum camera" one more time like it is a Ghostbusters Proton pack, I think I might injure myself.

Please - spend your money on ANY season of Ghosthunters, but not GHI.

I have been a fan of the original Ghost Hunters for years now and still enjoy plopping down on the sofa on Wednesday nights to watch the show.
I was thrilled when they announced they were going international, but as previously mentioned in another review, they picked the wrong people to send abroad. My husband and I often joke that they would find anything haunted including a speck of dust, which normally, Jay and Grant from the original GH series would recognize as a piece of dust or bug for what it is. The lead investigator(Rob)in GHI is very boring, doesn't bring the kind of fun and personality as the original GH's cast does. For people that are looking for a show that truly looks into paranormal activity, this spin off is not the place to look. The original Ghost Hunter's series is where you should be looking. Jay and Grant truly investigate in a scientific manner and only when they can't explain away evidence that they have tried to debunk, will they then declare a site to either have paranormal activity(notice they don't say it's haunted) or to be haunted if there is an overwhelming amount of evidence to suggest the location to be so. Rob, in the GHI series, is too overeager in proclaiming almost all the locations he visits as being haunted. To me that isn't much investigating and just more fodder to keep people watching the show, I don't think this spin off will last too long unless they do some major cast changes and bring in someone with a more objective standpoint.
as described. thank you we love it
Good stuff

Yes, I love the paranormal & supernatural.  I've been watching ghost hunters(Taps), since I had my strokes.  So ,paranormal & supernatural,horror,action adventure and thriller, sci-first is all I watch, occasionally mystery.
